required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of KF-0210 in Advanced Solid Tumors Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Multi-Center, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics and Anti-tumor Activity of KF-0210 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this Phase I, Multi-Center, Open-Label Study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics and anti-tumor activity of KF-0210 in participants with advanced solid tumors. The study will be conducted in two parts: phase Ia, and phase Ib.

detailed_description.textblock:
Phase 1a:
The primary objective of the phase 1a part of the study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamic and anti-tumor activity of oral KF-0210 as a single agent in participants with advanced solid tumors, to identify the dose-limiting toxicity and establish the maximum tolerated dose, or maximum administered dose and/or the recommended Phase II dose of KF-0210 in participants with advanced solid tumors.
Phase 1b:
The primary objective of the phase 1b part of the study is to assess the safety, pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamic and anti-tumor activity of KF-0210 in combination with Atezolizumab in patients with colorectal cancer (CRC) (MSS), lung cancer (LC), squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus (SCCE), gastric cancer (GC), and bladder cancer (BC).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of patient with adverse events / serious adverse events (AEs/SAEs) [Safety and Tolerability]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From consent through 28 days (±7 days) after the last dose or before starting other anti-tumor treatment (whichever occurs earlier)(up to approximately 1 year))
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events will be assessed according to CTCAE V5.0, and be coded according to the MedDRA Dictionary

primary_outcome.measure: Dose limiting toxicity (DLT) of KF-0210 [Tolerability]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Cycle 1 Day 1 to Cycle 1 Day 21, each cycle is 21 days.
primary_outcome.description: Dose limiting toxicity (DLT) will be considered to be related to KF-0210 according to CTCAE V5.0 including hematology toxicities, non-hematological toxicities and any other toxicities.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of KF-0210 alone [Tolerability]
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 21 days after first administration in cycle 1, each cycle is 21 days
primary_outcome.description: The Maximum tolerated dose (MTD) is defined as the highest dose at which ≤1、6 participants occurred dose limiting toxicity at each dose level.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Body Weight from Baseline [Safety]
primary_outcome.time_frame: On date of screening (within 7 days before the first dose), Day 1 of each cycle (each cycle is 21 days), and at the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Body Temperature from Baseline [Safety]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Pulse rate from Baseline [Safety]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Systolic pressure from Baseline [Safety]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Diastolic pressure from Baseline [Safety]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Heart rate from Baseline [Safety]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: Heart rate in beats per minute (Bpm) through 12-lead ECG assessment

primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: R-R interval measured in millisecond through 12-lead ECG assessment

primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: P-R interval measured in millisecond through 12-lead ECG assessment

primary_outcome.measure: Change of QRS complex from Baseline [Safety]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)

primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)

primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Fridericia's Correction QT (QTcF) interval from Baseline [Safety]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening to the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: Fridericia's Correction QT (QTcF) interval measured in millisecond through 12-lead ECG assessment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group-Performance Status (ECOG PS) from Baseline [Safety]
primary_outcome.time_frame: On date of screening (within 7 days before the first dose), Day 1 of each cycle (each cycle is 21 days), and at the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: The performance status will be evaluated in accordance with the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) criteria with the score range in 0 to 5. A score of 0 represents fully normal activity and a score of 5 represents death.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Total Protein (TP) from Baseline [Safety]
primary_outcome.time_frame: On date of screening (within 7 days before the first dose), Day 8, Day15, Day 21 of cycle 1 (each cycle is 21 days), Day 1 of each cycle from the cycle 2, and at the end of treatment/withdrawal (up to approximately 1 year)

primary_outcome.description: Physical examination includes skin, head, eyes, ears, nose and throat, lymph nodes, heart, chest, abdomen and extremities, and nervous system (speech, cranial nerves, motor ability, tendon reflexes, sensations, free movement)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase I a: specific time points from Cycle 1 Day 1 to Cycle 1 Day 8; Phase 1b: specific time points from Cycle 1 Day 1 to Cycle 4 Day 5, each cycle is 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: For KF-0210 alone in phase Ia, and for KF-0210 and Atezolizumab in Phase Ib. Calculated by non-compartmental analysis (NCA) for WinNonlin V8.2 (or above).

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time-zero extrapolated to infinite time (AUC0-inf)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 21 days after first administration in cycle 1, each cycle is 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Biomarker for pharmacodynamic assessment including interferon (IFN-γ), tumor necrosis factor (TNF-α), CXCL10 and CCL5.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 21 days after first administration in cycle 1, each cycle is 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: To explore the prostaglandin metabolites in urine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 21 days after first administration in cycle 1, each cycle is 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor biopsies will be analyzed by immunohistochemistry (IHC) for CD3+ T cells, CD8+ T cells and PD-L1 expression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in tumor size from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening through the last dose of treatment, each cycle is 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor assessment with CT scan or MRI. The anti-tumor activity will be evaluated according to the RECIST V1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening through the last dose of treatment, each cycle is 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor assessment with CT scan or MRI. The tumor lesions will be evaluated according to the RECIST V1.1 standard, and categorized into complete response(CR), partial response (PR), stable disease (SD) , and progressive disease (PD).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening through the last dose of treatment, each cycle is 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor assessment with CT scan or MRI. The tumor lesions will be evaluated according to the RECIST V1.1 standard, and categorized into complete response(CR), partial response (PR), stable disease (SD) , and progressive disease (PD).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening through the last dose of treatment, each cycle is 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor assessment with CT scan or MRI. The tumor lesions will be evaluated according to the RECIST V1.1 standard, and categorized into complete response(CR), partial response (PR), stable disease (SD) , and progressive disease (PD).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From screening through the last dose of treatment, each cycle is 21 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Tumor assessment with CT scan or MRI. The tumor lesions will be evaluated according to the RECIST V1.1 standard, and categorized into complete response(CR), partial response (PR), stable disease (SD) , and progressive disease (PD).

clinical_study.condition: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Esophagus

arm_group.description: KF-0210 tablet will be administered at 120 mg as a single agent orally once daily (QD) continuously in cycles (1 cycle=21 days) until the disease progression, intolerance, or informed consent withdrawal.

KF-0210 tablet will be administered at 240 mg as a single agent orally once daily (QD) continuously in cycles (1 cycle=21 days) until the disease progression, intolerance, or informed consent withdrawal.

KF-0210 tablet will be administered at 450 mg as a single agent orally once daily (QD) continuously in cycles (1 cycle=21 days) until the disease progression, intolerance, or informed consent withdrawal.

KF-0210 tablet will be administered at 600 mg as a single agent orally once daily (QD) continuously in cycles (1 cycle=21 days) until the disease progression, intolerance, or informed consent withdrawal.

KF-0210 (dose RP2D-2, orally once daily)+ Atezolizumab (1200 mg every 3 weeks) continuously until disease progression/recurrence or death from any cause, or serious adverse events (SAE) observed (whichever occurs earlier) for up to 2 years.

KF-0210 (dose RP2D-1, orally once daily)+ Atezolizumab (1200 mg every 3 weeks) continuously until disease progression/recurrence or death from any cause, or serious adverse events (SAE) observed (whichever occurs earlier) for up to 2 years.

KF-0210 (dose RP2D, orally once daily)+ Atezolizumab (1200 mg every 3 weeks) continuously until disease progression/recurrence or death from any cause, or serious adverse events (SAE) observed (whichever occurs earlier) for up to 2 years.

intervention.description: KF-0210 tablet will be orally administered as a single agent at 120 mg once daily (QD) continuously, until the disease progression, intolerance, or informed consent withdrawal.
KF-0210 tablet will be orally administered as a single agent at 240 mg once daily (QD) continuously, until the disease progression, intolerance, or informed consent withdrawal.
KF-0210 tablet will be orally administered as a single agent at 450 mg once daily (QD) continuously, until the disease progression, intolerance, or informed consent withdrawal.
KF-0210 tablet will be orally administered as a single agent at 600 mg once daily (QD) continuously, until the disease progression, intolerance, or informed consent withdrawal.
KF-0210 tablet will be orally administered at dosage RP2D-2 once daily (QD) in combination with Atezolizumab that will be administered at 1200 mg every 3 weeks via intravenously infusion.
KF-0210 tablet will be orally administered at dosage RP2D-1 once daily (QD) in combination with Atezolizumab that will be administered at 1200 mg every 3 weeks via intravenously infusion.
KF-0210 tablet will be orally administered at dosage RP2D once daily (QD) in combination with Atezolizumab that will be administered at 1200 mg every 3 weeks via intravenously infusion.
